intro: Homoeatherum chinense, commonly known as Chinese stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to China. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, thick leaves that store water, allowing it to thrive in arid conditions. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow or white, typically during the spring or early summer. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its compact growth habit and ability to bloom reliably. Homoeatherum chinense prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it suitable for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
